PURCHASE CONTRACT

Contract No.: TRAMMO-P-2026-0142
Date: January 15, 2026

BETWEEN:
Trammo, Inc. â€” Ammonia Division ("Buyer")
AND:
Yara International ASA ("Seller")

TRAMMO GENERAL TERMS AND CONDITIONS (FOB PURCHASE)

1. PRODUCT AND SPECIFICATIONS

Product: Anhydrous Ammonia (NH3)
Product Specifications:
  - Purity: minimum 99.5%
  - Water: maximum 0.5%
  - Oil: maximum 5 ppm
  - Temperature: minus 33 degrees Celsius at loading

2. QUANTITY

Quantity: 25,000 metric tons +/- 5% more or less at seller's option.
Shipping tolerance to be at vessel's option within the above range.

3. INCOTERMS

INCOTERMS 2020: FOB Trinidad and Tobago.

4. PRICE

Price: US $385.00 per metric ton FOB loading port.

5. ORIGIN

Origin: Any origin acceptable to Buyer. Seller reserves the right but not the obligation to supply from alternate origin.

6. PORT(S) OF LOADING

Port(s) of Loading: One safe port, one safe berth, Point Lisas, Trinidad.
Draft guarantee of 38 feet at loading berth.

7. LOADING DATES

Loading Dates: During the period March 1 - March 15, 2026. Buyer to give Seller
15 days prior notice of vessel nomination.

8. PAYMENT

Payment: By irrevocable letter of credit opened in Seller's favor, payable at sight
against presentation of shipping documents. Payment to be made within 30 days from
bill of lading date.

9. LAYTIME AND DEMURRAGE

Laytime: Laytime for loading shall be calculated based on B/L quantity divided by
discharge rate of 800 mt per hour, all weather days, Sundays and holidays included.
Demurrage: $35,000 per day or pro rata for any part of a day. Demurrage claims
must be presented within 90 calendar days from completion of loading.

10. CHARTER PARTY

The Charter Party (ASBATANKVOY form) is incorporated by reference herein.
For the purposes of this contract, Seller shall be deemed "owner" and Buyer
shall be deemed "charterer."

11. NOTICE OF READINESS

Notice of Readiness (NOR) to be tendered by the vessel master upon arrival at
loading port. Laytime shall commence 6 hours after NOR is tendered or upon vessel
being all fast at berth, whichever is earlier.

12. PRESENTATION AND COOL DOWN

Presentation: Vessel's cargo tanks must be in a suitable condition for loading ammonia.
Cool down and gassing of cargo tanks shall be at buyer's account. Ammonia used for
cool down and purging shall be for buyer's expense. Time used for cool down shall
not count as laytime.

13. VESSEL CLASSIFICATION AND ELIGIBILITY

Vessel Classification and Eligibility: The vessel shall be entered in a class
maintained by a member of IACS, and shall carry P&I insurance with a club that
is a member of the International Group. Vessel must comply with ISPS Code.
The vessel must comply with MTSA requirements and USCG approval.
Seller reserves the right to reject any vessel that does not meet terminal acceptance criteria.

14. INSPECTION

Inspection: An independent inspector shall be jointly appointed by Seller and Buyer.
Costs to be shared equally. Bill of lading quantity shall be final and binding for
all purposes including invoicing and settlement.

15. DOCUMENTS

Documents required upon loading: commercial invoice, full set of bills of lading,
certificate of origin, EUR 1 movement certificate, and all other shipping documents
customary for the trade.

16. COMPLIANCE WITH EXPORT AND IMPORT LAWS

Compliance with Export and Import Laws: Each party warrants that the transactions
contemplated herein are not prohibited by any applicable export or import laws.
The product has been registered under REACH. Seller shall provide Safety Data Sheet
prior to first shipment.

17. WAR RISK

War Risk: Any additional war risk insurance premium or surcharge assessed by the
Joint War Committee shall be for Buyer's account.

18. FORCE MAJEURE

Force Majeure: Neither party shall be liable for failure to perform caused by
Force Majeure events including but not limited to acts of God, war, civil unrest,
strikes, government action, or natural disasters. The affected party must notify
the other party within 5 business days notice of the occurrence.
Force Majeure shall not affect demurrage obligations already accrued.

19. DEFAULT AND REMEDIES

Event of Default: If either party fails to perform any material obligation and
does not cure such failure within 48 hours of written notice, the non-defaulting
party may terminate this contract. Interest on late payments shall accrue at
2.5% per annum above LIBOR. Each party's right of setoff and netting against
amounts owed under this or any other agreement is preserved.

20. CLAIMS

Claims: Any claim arising under this contract must be submitted in writing within
15 days of completion of discharge. All claims shall be absolutely barred unless
arbitration proceedings are initiated within one year from the date of discharge.

21. GOVERNING LAW AND ARBITRATION

Governing Law: This contract shall be governed by English law.
Arbitration: Any dispute arising under this contract shall be referred to
arbitration in London under LMAA terms.

22. NOTICES

Notices: All notices under this contract shall be deemed to be given when
delivered by courier, fax, or e-mail to the addresses specified in the contract.

23. MISCELLANEOUS

Miscellaneous: This contract constitutes the Entire Agreement between the parties.
No Modifications shall be effective unless in writing and signed by both parties.
No Waiver of any breach shall constitute a waiver of any subsequent breach.
Neither party may effect an Assignment without written consent. If any provision
is found to be unenforceable, Severability shall apply.
